t: John 10
The Good Shepherd
“Truly*rp I*r tell*r you,*r anyone*r who*r doesn’t*r enter*r the*r sheep*r pen*r by*r the*r gate*r but*r climbs*r in*r some*r other*r way*r is*r a*r thief*r and*r a*r robber.*r
The*r one*r who*r enters*r by*r the*r gate*r is*r the*r shepherd*r of*r the*r sheep.*r
The*r gatekeeper*r opens*r it*r for*r him,*r and*r the*r sheep*r hear*r his*r voice.*r He*r calls*r his*r own*r sheep*r by*r name*r and*r leads*r them*r out.*r
When*r he*r has*r brought*r all*r his*r own*r outside,*r he*r goes*r ahead*r of*r them.*r The*r sheep*r follow*r him*r because*r they*r know*r his*r voice.*r
They*r will*r never*r follow*r a*r stranger;*r instead*r they*r will*r run*r away*r from*r him,*r because*r they*r don’t*r know*r the*r voice*r of*r strangers.”*r
Jesus gave them this figure of speech, but they did not understand what he was telling them.
Jesus*p said again, “Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r I*r am*r the*r gate*r for*r the*r sheep.*r
All*r who*r came*r before*r me*r are*r thieves*r and*r robbers,*r but*r the*r sheep*r didn’t*r listen*r to*r them.*r
I*r am*r the*r gate.*r If*r anyone*r enters*r by*r me,*r he*r will*r be*r saved*r and*r will*r come*r in*r and*r go*r out*r and*r find*r pasture.*r
A*r thief*r comes*r only*r to*r steal*r and*r kill*r and*r destroy.*r I*r have*r come*r so*r that*r they*r may*r have*r life*r and*r have*r it*r in*r abundance.*r
“I*rp am*r the*r good*r shepherd.*r The*r good*r shepherd*r lays*r down*r his*r life*r for*r the*r sheep.*r

The*r hired*r hand,*r since*r he*r is*r not*r the*r shepherd*r and*r doesn’t*r own*r the*r sheep,*r leaves*r them*r and*r runs*r away*r when*r he*r sees*r a*r wolf*r coming.*r The*r wolf*r then*r snatches*r and*r scatters*r them.*r
This*r happens*r because*r he*r is*r a*r hired*r hand*r and*r doesn’t*r care*r about*r the*r sheep.*r
“I*rp am*r the*r good*r shepherd.*r I*r know*r my*r own,*r and*r my*r own*r know*r me,*r
just*r as*r the*r Father*r knows*r me,*r and*r I*r know*r the*r Father.*r I*r lay*r down*r my*r life*r for*r the*r sheep.*r

But*r I*r have*r other*r sheep*r that*r are*r not*r from*r this*r sheep*r pen;*r I*r must*r bring*r them*r also,*r and*r they*r will*r listen*r to*r my*r voice.*r Then*r there*r will*r be*r one*r flock,*r one*r shepherd.*r
This*r is*r why*r the*r Father*r loves*r me,*r because*r I*r lay*r down*r my*r life*r so*r that*r I*r may*r take*r it*r up*r again.*r

No*r one*r takes*r it*r from*r me,*r but*r I*r lay*r it*r down*r on*r my*r own.*r I*r have*r the*r right*r to*r lay*r it*r down,*r and*r I*r have*r the*r right*r to*r take*r it*r up*r again.*r I*r have*r received*r this*r command*r from*r my*r Father.”*r
Again*p the Jews were divided because of these words.
Many of them were saying, “He has a demon and he’s crazy. Why do you listen to him?”
Others were saying, “These aren’t the words of someone who is demon-possessed. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?”
Jesus at the Festival of Dedication
Then*p the Festival of Dedication took place in Jerusalem, and it was winter.
Jesus was walking in the temple in Solomon’s Colonnade.
The Jews surrounded him and asked, “How long are you going to keep us in suspense? If you are the Messiah, tell us plainly.”
“I*rp did*r tell*r you*r and*r you*r don’t*r believe,”*r Jesus answered them. “The*r works*r that*r I*r do*r in*r my*r Father’s*r name*r testify*r about*r me.*r
But*r you*r don’t*r believe*r because*r you*r are*r not*r of*r my*r sheep.*r
My*r sheep*r hear*r my*r voice,*r I*r know*r them,*r and*r they*r follow*r me.*r
I*r give*r them*r eternal*r life,*r and*r they*r will*r never*r perish.*r No*r one*r will*r snatch*r them*r out*r of*r my*r hand.*r
My*r Father,*r who*r has*r given*r them*r to*r me,*r is*r greater*r than*r all.*r No*r one*r is*r able*r to*r snatch*r them*r out*r of*r the*r Father’s*r hand.*r
I*r and*r the*r Father*r are*r one.”*r
Renewed Efforts to Stone Jesus
Again*p the Jews picked up rocks to stone him.
Jesus*p replied, “I*r have*r shown*r you*r many*r good*r works*r from*r the*r Father.*r For*r which*r of*r these*r works*r are*r you*r stoning*r me?”*r
“We*p aren’t stoning you for a good work,” the Jews answered, “but for blasphemy, because you - being a man - make yourself God.”
Jesus*p answered them, “Isn’t*r it*r written*r in*r your*r law,*r I*ir said,*ir you*ir are*ir gods?*ir
If*r he*r called*r those*r to*r whom*r the*r word*r of*r God*r came*r ‘gods’ -*r and*r the*r Scripture*r cannot*r be*r broken -*r
do*r you*r say,*r ‘You*r are*r blaspheming’*r to*r the*r one*r the*r Father*r set*r apart*r and*r sent*r into*r the*r world,*r because*r I*r said:*r I*r am*r the*r Son*r of*r God?*r
If*r I*r am*r not*r doing*r my*r Father’s*r works,*r don’t*r believe*r me.*r

But*r if*r I*r am*r doing*r them*r and*r you*r don’t*r believe*r me,*r believe*r the*r works.*r This*r way*r you*r will*r know*r and*r understand*r that*r the*r Father*r is*r in*r me*r and*r I*r in*r the*r Father.”*r
Then they were trying again to seize him, but he escaped their grasp.
Many beyond the Jordan Believe in Jesus
So*p he departed again across the Jordan to the place where John had been baptizing earlier, and he remained there.
Many came to him and said, “John never did a sign, but everything John said about this man was true.”
And many believed in him there.
